page.title: 12Housing In The Area
page.content: The houses tend to be detatched or semi-detatched with a few terraces. A large proportion are over 100 years old with a small proportion of modern houses which have been built since the second world war. The majority are brick built, with a small percentage of stone and wood. These tend to be the older houses. The main roofing material is tile, but there is still a considerable number with slate and a smaller number of thatch remaining. The houses tend to be larger than average with 4 or more bedrooms, very few of the 1/2 bedroom type.The majority have 2 or more rooms on the ground floor, many with the addition of utility rooms and/or cloakrooms. Some families have lived in the area for centuries but there has been a steady influx of new families now owning cars.
